CASPOFUNGIN

  • Indications and doses
  • Pregnancy
  • Hepatic impairment
  • Side effects
  • Administration
  • Medicinal forms

Indications and doses

Invasive aspergillosis, Invasive candidiasis, Empirical treatment of systemic fungal infections in patients with neutropenia,

By intravenous infusion

  • For adults (body-weight up to 81 kg)
    70 mg once daily for 1 day, then 50 mg once daily.
  • For adults (body-weight 81 kg and above)
    70 mg once daily.

Advice when patient is pregnant

Manufacturer advises avoid unless essential—toxicity in animal studies.

Advice regarding hepatic impairment

70 mg on first day then 35 mg once daily in moderate impairment.

No information available for severe impairment.

Known side effects

General side effects

commonOrVeryCommon: Arthralgia, diarrhoea, dyspnoea, headache, hypokalaemia, injection-site reactions, nausea, pruritus, rash, sweating, vomiting,

uncommon: Abdominal pain, anaemia, anorexia, anxiety, arrhythmia, ascites, blurred vision, bronchospasm, chest pain, cholestasis, constipation, cough, disorientation, dizziness, dry mouth, dyspepsia, dysphagia, erythema multiforme, fatigue, flatulence, flushing, heart failure, hepatic dysfunction, hyperglycaemia, hypertension, hypoaesthesia, hypocalcaemia, hypomagnesaemia, hypotension, leucopenia, metabolic acidosis, muscular weakness, myalgia, palpitation, paraesthesia, renal failure, sleep disturbances, taste disturbances, thrombocytopenia, thrombophlebitis, tremor,

notKnown: Adult respiratory distress syndrome, anaphylaxis,

Directions for administration

For intravenous infusion (Cancidas ), give intermittently in Sodium chloride 0.9%. Allow vial to reach room temperature; initially reconstitute each vial with 10.5 mL water for injections, mixing gently to dissolve then dilute requisite dose in 250 mL infusion fluid (35- or 50-mg doses may be diluted in 100 ml infusion fluid if necessary); give over 60 minutes; incompatible with glucose solutions.

Prepared medicinal forms of CASPOFUNGIN

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Powder for solution for infusion
